div.p: Editor of Der Kunstwart and its continuation as the Deutsche Zeitschrift 1926 to 1937.

div.head: Rinn and Schenker
div.p: Schenker had extensive correspondence with Rinn between February 1927 and December 1934 (OJ 5/32, 14 items;OJ 13/25, 45 items). Rinn corresponded under the letterheads of Der Kunstwart and its continuation as the Deutsche Zeitschrift, of Munich, of which he was editor between October 1926 and 1937. In correspondence with UE, Schenker arranged for a complete set of Der Tonwille to be sent to Rinn in December 1930 (WSLB 424, OC 52/866).

Schenker published six articles in the journal, the first three under the Der Kunstwart masthead, the latter three under that of the Deutsche Zeitschrift: Eine Rettung der klassischen Musik-Texte: Das Archiv für Photogramme in der National-Bibliothek, Wien, vol. 42 (March 1929), 359‒67 [concerning the Minuet from the Schubert Piano Sonata in G, Op. 78 (D. 894)] Gedanken über Kultur, Kunst und Musik, vol. 44 (Jan 1931), 222‒30 [excerpted from the “Vermischtes” of the three Meisterwerk yearbooks] Ein verschollener Brief von Mozart und das Geheimnis seines Schaffens, vol. 44 (July 1931), 660‒66 Eine Anzeige und eine Selbstanzeige, vol. 46 (Dec 1932), 194‒96 Erinnerung an Brahms, vol. 46 (May 1933), 475‒82 [written for the centenary of Brahms's birth] Vom Unterschied zwischen der italienischen und der deutschen Musik, vol. 47 (August 1934), 700‒703 Copies of all six are preserved in OJ 20/10.
